website_summaries.verdict: All of the yummy nut flavor that parrots love without the unhealthy fat, ZuPreem’s NutBlend is a far better choice for picky eaters who can’t get enough peanuts, walnuts, and Brazil nuts.
pros: Corn, soybean meal, and wheat are the first 3 ingredients
Packed with essential vitamins and minerals
cons: These nutty pellets consist of 80% of your parrot’s daily diet, and should be supplemented with fruits and seeds

customer_reviews.title: Check the size of the pieces before buying.
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy the Zupreem Natural. It wasn't available and so I bought this. The pieces are very BIG... I have an African Grey who prefers to hold his pellets and nibble, so I thought it wouldn't be a big deal. It was a deal... I change his dish every day and put the left overs out for the wild birds. The blue jays didn't like them either and so they were eventually eaten at night by the racoons who had a little trouble chomping them down.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: 44 yr old Yellow Crowned Amazon FINALLY converted from seed
customer_reviews.text: I took over care of Alice Q Bird when she was 15. She was wild caught in 1969 (I know.....) and was deeply addicted to seed. I coaxed her over to healthy "people food" over the years, but couldn't convert her off of seed, spending $300+ over the years, trying everything under the sun. Finally! I found this and she LOVES it! She was getting a little Vitamin A deficiency, even though I fed her plenty of organic carrots, but after a month of Zupreem's Nut Blend, her feet went back to normal and her very quiet wheeze went away. Now on month 14 and she's a huge fan. "I love you too Alice!"
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B

customer_reviews.title: New Smaller Pellet Size Means Less Waste.
customer_reviews.text: My two African Greys love this stuff, but as any one with a parrot knows, a lot of what a parrot puts in its beak to eat winds up falling to the bottom of the cage, which is money wasted. Some of these pellets were pretty large, particularly the larger, brown, banana shaped pieces that kind of look like Brazil nuts. Zupreem appears to have made the pellets a smaller, more appropriate size in keeping with other pellets.
customer_reviews.author: Ring Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Very picky boys & girls!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found something that my blue & gold macaw likes besides Browns Big Bites for Big Beaks! Used Browns for many yrs because all my parrots loved it. Never mind the expense, even as the cost has more than doubled! But the quality went waaaay down! Fewer nuts now, mostly mildewy peanuts, lots of filler so small even a parakeet wouldn’t eat it. But, these pellets seem to satisfy him & he just crunch’s away...
customer_reviews.author: selfishpc1

customer_reviews.title: WOW – PARROT APPROVED
customer_reviews.text: We have a finicky Lilac Crested Amazon Parrot who would eat until she popped if given only fruit flavored pellets. When your bird digs through droppings instead of eating veggie fortified pellets in protest then you have to find a solution. Our girl LOVES the Nutblend pellets! And boy, they are big so we dole the food out, mixing it with the fun fiesta and fruit pellets plus fresh food and Nutriberries. It's good having a happy bird.
customer_reviews.author: L.M.FieldsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Too small NOW for my Amazons, Macaws, Cockatoos
customer_reviews.text: It seems they have changed the size of this bird food from big to small. Instead of one food for large birds and another for smaller birds they have downed sized this food. My Amazons, Macaws, Cockatoos refuse to eat this food now. I thought this was the old large size. Well it is not and a pure waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Sherrill

customer_reviews.title: This has changed!!
customer_reviews.text: This seems different. My parrot likes this flavor and brand but I notice it is lighter and not as dense. There are also a whole lot of the brazil nuts (largest pieces) I usually have to throw those away because my parrot won't eat them. So when I saw the over abundance of them this time what a waste of my money. I think I'll need to find a different kind now.
customer_reviews.author: francesca simonton

customer_reviews.title: My African Grey likes this
customer_reviews.text: My bird likes this and I had no trouble changing him to these after years on another ZuPreem food. I chose the "nut" flavor because he loves all nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Davis

customer_reviews.title: good for picky picky birds out there!
customer_reviews.text: My two pickiest birds love this and scramble down to get some when fed! They insist on a safflower seed based diet and I've tried for twenty years to get them to eat some type of pellet so I'm very happy they love this! My other bird has been on pretty bird since a chick, but loves loves loves this mixed in for something different! I'm very happy to find thus and so happy it appeals to my three parrots. I've already purchased another bag.
customer_reviews.author: Flowergirl

customer_reviews.title: The product has changed, size is much smaller
customer_reviews.text: My Congo African Gray parrot was raised on this food and I continued giving it to him when I purchased it. I used to buy it from another company that went out of business. After I ran low I purchased it on Amazon. The product has changed. The pellets are very much smaller and my parrot does not eat them as well as the old ones. I can’t read his mind, so I don’t know if it tastes differently or if it’s because the pellets are smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Zabrecky

customer_reviews.title: Nuggets are smaller than you buy at your pet store
customer_reviews.text: The nuggets are a smaller version of what I purchase from my local pet store The packaging is exactly the same Also, the pellets from this site are more round than shaped like a peanut I’m still determining if my Green Wing Macaw is eating them or dumping them out If she’s eating them , then she loves them.
customer_reviews.author: atthejim

customer_reviews.title: Vet recommended Zupreem pellets for my 40 year old Amazon so ...
customer_reviews.text: Vet recommended Zupreem pellets for my 40 year old Amazon so we've tested the fruit, veggies, and nut varieties. The parrot is very picky and it took him a while to do anything besides "bombs away!" with the pellets but he now will eat the smaller pieces. Compared to the fruit pellets, these are much larger and would probably be appreciated by larger parrots.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: B&G Macaw Loves
customer_reviews.text: Our macaw loves these treats. We only buy ZuPreem foods for him to accompany his vegetable and fruit diet. He is 30+ years old and our vet says he is healthy and beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: esseeTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Zupreem Nut Blend
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for pellets that were larger, these pellets are good for smaller birds, I have a macaw and they are too small. Zupreem used to make a large pellet nut blend, I don't seem to be able to get it, very sad as Jinx will not eat the small pellets even though this flavor used to be her fav!
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: New size, not a hit
customer_reviews.text: My Amazon loved the original larger size, he enjoys holding food and nibbling on it. New size is too small, he leaves most of them or tosses them. Had to stop purchasing since size changed.
customer_reviews.author: KimM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Received item as usual, but when I opened the box the bag of bird food had already been opened or cut, I am afraid to feed it to my bird because it’s not factory sealed, but amazon says it’s non refundable, I have bought this item several times and never had this issue. so I don’t know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Birds are picky!
customer_reviews.text: My cockatoo would only eat the dark brown (Brazil nut style) pellets, even though others were colored pretty close to the natural pellets he regularly eats. Not a bad product, you have to try just about anything at least once when you have a parrot, so don't let this review discourage you from offering it to you bird.. Mine just didn't care for it that much. Too bad birds don't select their food based on smell because these smell great! LOL
customer_reviews.author: wtchy1

customer_reviews.title: Product has changed, is way too big.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered this exact product for my Grey, countless times. Now however, the food pieces are HUGE! He can’t eat them. It’s not eligible for return. So, I’m out the money and my parrot is out of food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome blend!
customer_reviews.text: Our Sulphur-Crested cockatoo LOVES and I mean LOVES this flavor!! The pieces are large enough for her to hold them with her foot and munch away on them. If your bird likes peanuts at all, they will probably like this particular flavor!
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Five star will definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: This bird food looks a lot like what I was buying at Walmart but my bird likes it so much better! I am so happy because my bird loves this food so much and I’m very pleased and will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K.

customer_reviews.title: Ordering another bag
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical as my older greys are seed junkies and only grudgingly eat the fruit blend mixed 50/50 with their seeds. But they seem to like this far better than the fruit blend, especially the ones shaped like Brazil nuts and the ones shaped like peanuts. Now I have them over to a third fruit blend, a third nut blend and a third their old seeds after more than 15 years of trying to switch them to a pellet diet. (They won't touch the regular pellets at all.)
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Dehm

customer_reviews.title: Bird won't eat it.
customer_reviews.text: My yellow naped amazon won't touch this food. He likes the fruit flavor so I assumed he would like this. He refuses to eat any of it so now I have to throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: butteguy

customer_reviews.title: Healthy pellets!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this Zupreem pellets for my Macaws!! This is what I first weaned them to when I switched them from their unhealthy seed diet. Easiest to switch to because of the shape and flavor, then gradually added the fruit pellets.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Waid

customer_reviews.title: Finicky Bird
customer_reviews.text: I have fed my blue front amazon the zupreem fruit blend for years and thought this would make a nice treat. I just put a few pieces in with his regular feed but most of the nut blend is still there when I change his feed. It's been several weeks now and I don't know if I should try to give him only this for a day or if that would stress him...he's 28 years old and I've had him since he was an infant. I'm a fan of zupreem but my bird is not willing to try this.
customer_reviews.author: G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My African gray loves this. Regular food she throws out on the floor
customer_reviews.author: Cheryld213

customer_reviews.title: Zupreme is always good
customer_reviews.text: Zupreme always good for my bird --sometimes he likes the nut flavor best --sometimes not! He always likes real nuts in the shell better but I have to give him some basic pellet food too!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Anderson

customer_reviews.title: My Grey Loves this food
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey loves this food. More than just about any other food, a lot more than the fruit flavored. My only complaint is she wastes so much of it. I am always picking it up and putting it back in her bowl. If it were only a little smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I got a bad batch!
customer_reviews.text: I started feeding my 2 birds (green cheek and Nanday Conure) the nut blend for about 2 weeks. Suddenly one night both of them Died! No other changes in food or environment except using the Nut Blend instead of the Fruit Blend! I cannot even send it back or even tell them the codes on the bag since I switch them to a container. I am NOT blaming them however I just cannot figure out what killed both of them in one night! My cockatiel did not eat them and he is fine!
customer_reviews.author: Margret Smith

customer_reviews.title: Our Sulfur Crested Cockatoo loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We have a picky seed eating bird that has never been interested in pellets. She would sometimes eat the purple berries in the fruit blend by Zupreem, but mostly they would end up on the floor of her cage while she gobbled up the safflower seeds. While she still gets seeds, I have high hopes of transitioning her to these pellets only in the future. She is eating them consistently and picks out the dark brown ones before she goes for her seeds. Highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: William Frantz

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We got the nut blend today for my African Grey and he loved it. My husband put a handful over his existing food and he ate it all. He talked and sang all afternoon, he was so happy!
customer_reviews.author: Judy T

customer_reviews.title: Zupreem NutBend Pellets
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to find this product as I thought my five parrots would love the nutty taste and shapes. Don't know what the deal was, but none of them liked it, even with periodic "resampling". Our wild critters outside, however, have eagerly devoured the pellets so I am happy someone got the goodies!
customer_reviews.author: FITZ

customer_reviews.title: didnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: wont give it 1 star since it isnt their fault but my senegal and mini macaw wont eat it. they literally threw it out of the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Mr and Mrs. R

customer_reviews.title: Zupreme the best!
customer_reviews.text: I own a Blue Crown Conure, Hans Macaw and a Jenday and all three of them love these pellets. My Jenday sits for 10 - 15 mins breaking each pellet apart as they are quite big but he still wants to have one or three when I put them out. So not really for anything smaller than a Jenday.
customer_reviews.author: Carol and Andy

customer_reviews.title: fruit and veggie especially it’s a great food and healthy
customer_reviews.text: My parrot is 20 years old and she has been raised eating Zupreem ONLY!!! Never seed!!! She loves all flavors, fruit and veggie especially it’s a great food and healthy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jami Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Zupreem Nut Blend are the only pellets my will eat - they are 30 years old and I just got them to switch to pellets (for their health). I have to eat some pellets with them at dinner and breakfast so they don't think I'm getting something better than them - and these are acceptable to me too (they have no flavor I'm my opinion). But the birds are eating this and I am a grateful parrot owner.
customer_reviews.author: ParrotQueen

customer_reviews.title: Pieces smaller
customer_reviews.text: Last time I ordered this, the pieces were a lot bigger. This is the only flavor of pellets that my cockatoo will eat. But she prefers the larger pieces. She is not eating as many from this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: My B&G Macaw loves this food.
customer_reviews.text: It took my B&G Macaw a little while to get used to this, but she gobbles it up now and doesn't leave any in her bowl. I feed her Zupreem fruit pellets as well, so this bag has lasted quite awhile. Also, I bought this because of the vitamins, and I believe this food has helped her feathers & skin. I will definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Yummy, yummy
customer_reviews.text: Our sun conure really enjoys this food. He also eats the fruit blend and enjoys that too. I wish this nut flavor came in a smaller size though. He tends to bite the pellet a few times and then drops it to the floor for my dogs to eat. ha ha We get the fruit flavor in the extra small size and he eats that a lot more efficiently. :) But, he loves this flavor so much that I don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: J. Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Not my birds' favorite.
customer_reviews.text: My bird seems to like the regular blend but not the nut blend so much.
customer_reviews.author: Maxx Metal

customer_reviews.title: They both seem to like it and they are both still alive
customer_reviews.text: I give this along with ZuPreem fruit blend Nutriberries and peanuts to my Cockatoo and Conure. They both seem to like it and they are both still alive, so I guess it is okay.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Randolph

customer_reviews.title: My Parrot Loves These!
customer_reviews.text: My double yellow head amazon parrot loves this food - I was skeptical at first - as the only bird food she has ever eaten was Nutri-berries, yet she is picking these out of her dish first and seems to love the nutty flavor. The vet keeps saying to get her on a "pellet diet," yet she refuses to touch anything resembling the kibble type.
customer_reviews.author: jeanieluv

customer_reviews.title: Good find for my parrot
customer_reviews.text: My 42+ yr old Mexican Double Yellow Head parrot is enjoying this better than previous attempts to transition to pellets...
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen W

customer_reviews.title: Sengal Parrot loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My bird loves this food. I have been mixing it with the ZuPreem Natural Diet Bird food and he picks this food out and eats it first. I am going to use this for his main food all the time when I run out of the other stuff. Smells nice too...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "likes them all"
customer_reviews.text: we purchased three items at one time. they were fruit blend, nut and veggie blend. we believe our Sun Conure Archie likes all three of the items purchased. we do believe based on Archie's eating persistence ,that his favorite of the three items was the fruit blend. He does like all these and when needed we will be sure to try some of the other blends as well.
customer_reviews.author: Star gazer

customer_reviews.title: Smells so good Mommy wants to eat it!!
customer_reviews.text: my 11 yo medium sulfer crested cockatoo eats this mixed with the veggie and fruit blend everyday..the smell is amazing, looks like nuts and he seems to really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Shureevil Knevil

customer_reviews.title: MY PARROT LOVES IT
customer_reviews.text: I could care less, but my bird loves it. She told me so lol. Plus it has all the nutrients my parrot needs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: My Cockatoo loves them!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only pellet that my Goffin's Cockatoo will eat. She was raised on strictly seeds, and I have tried numerous varieties and brands of pellets trying to get her to switch to them. She wouldn't touch any of the others, but seems to really like these.
customer_reviews.author: PenderRedHed

customer_reviews.title: Not nutritious enough.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for a newly adopted 17 year old blue and gold macaw. After ordering, I read extruded pellets were not good because the heat process is so high it destroys much of the nutrients. I won't buy them again. I would rather feed only the best.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this product as yet. SunConure is eating it.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if my SunConure likes it! Some days it eats one color the next the other. Bur at least he is eating it. He likes apples a lot and of course walnuts (only as a treat or for training). I was hoping this would provide the nutritional content with the nut flavor he likes.
customer_reviews.author: NotTheDr

customer_reviews.title: Great sales price
customer_reviews.text: Great sales price. Bird is taking to it slowly but she is improving with feather growth. I love the sale price and will order again! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: leezasez

customer_reviews.title: Nutty Parrot food
customer_reviews.text: The parrots love this and I know it's good for them!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Z Burris

customer_reviews.title: Pieces are ridiculously large even though it says medium and ...
customer_reviews.text: Pieces are ridiculously large even though it says medium and conure size. I have a green cheek conure who dislikes the large size. A solution would be to break the largest pieces in half if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great New Pellets
customer_reviews.text: So far, none of my flock are in love with this stuff, but I have high hopes. I've been giving it to them for only a few weeks, so far. We'll have to wait and see what happens. I really hope that they learn to give it a try and like it. They are used to Rainbow Zupreem pellets.
customer_reviews.author: saturday mourning

customer_reviews.title: Must be tasty
customer_reviews.text: This is the only pelleted food my African Gray will eat.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Sez

customer_reviews.title: Worth a Try
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to try to coax my rescue 22yo African Grey to try pellets. No luck yet. The pellets do taste ok to me and are softer than the fruit flavor. I've crushed up some of the pellets as they're pretty large and am giving them to my tiels and canaries with great success, they love them!
customer_reviews.author: Elissa

customer_reviews.title: Expiration date was not legible. Could be 12/31/13 or ...
customer_reviews.text: Expiration date was not legible. Could be 12/31/13 or 12/31/18. If 2013, the food could be dangerous to my conure. 2018 would be too far in the future. Received a refund from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Big macaws like the large pellets. Wish they sold just those.
customer_reviews.author: PAL

customer_reviews.title: and he doesn't seem to like it.
customer_reviews.text: It says for conures on the bag, but it must be for the largest breed of conures. My little pineapple conure can barely hold the larger pieces, and he doesn't seem to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a comfort that he will eat something so good for him
customer_reviews.text: Most important is my "big boy" loves this and he is a very picky eater. It is a comfort that he will eat something so good for him ! When I got this bird ........... he was on a diet of pretzels beer and pizza............. and two years later he is the picture of health thanks to Zupreem
customer_reviews.author: Ardith in MN

customer_reviews.title: Conure says no to Nutblend
customer_reviews.text: My nut-loving conure does not like this product. The pieces are too large and hard for him. I've been putting them through the blender, but he's still lukewarm.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I doubt these pellets are for medium sized birds like Conures. Other than that
customer_reviews.text: My conures are having a hard time even grabbing the piece that I break into two or three. I doubt these pellets are for medium sized birds like Conures. Other than that, they don't eat them even when broken into pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Delphi

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: My conure didn't like it but maybe other conures will the pellets are very large.
customer_reviews.author: CMFV

customer_reviews.title: Conure approved
customer_reviews.text: My Sun Conure loves this food. I put it in the Activitoy Nut Case...it makes a great forage treat.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Z

customer_reviews.title: No issue with the product my birds just hated it
customer_reviews.text: I don't know that it is a problem specifically with the blend itself. But my Macaw absolutely hated it. I even tried to soak them. I had to throw the pellets to the wild birds. I soaked them and broke them down for my CAG to try and he is a very healthy eater and he wanted nothing to do with them.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Childers

customer_reviews.title: Changes ingredients?
customer_reviews.text: These were better in the past. During the last year, they no longer have the peanut butter smell when you open the bag. Instead, it's a very plasticy smell. The parrot eats it, so maybe it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Bedwell

customer_reviews.title: African Grey loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey took to it right away and she can be picky!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Eisenhauer

customer_reviews.title: Birds fussy, kick them out of the bowl
customer_reviews.text: I tried mixing these up in my parrot's bowl (a mix of kaytee, pretty bird, and Zupreme large multicolored and shaped pellets) but they won't eat them yet. It usually takes a while. If they start to eat them, I'll come back and edit this review.
customer_reviews.author: The_Nightfly

customer_reviews.title: NutBlend Flavor and Smell
customer_reviews.text: My Citron Cockatoo loves this! He's a picky eater and if he doesn't like something he will either throw it out or it will just sit in his bowl untouched. He was excited at the smell when I put it in his dish and couldn't wait to get down and start eating it. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Molly K

customer_reviews.title: Package  not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Was not as pictured. Was not the new smaller pellet size as pictured, but was the old larger size pellets . Probably old stock
customer_reviews.author: PAUL K.

customer_reviews.title: My parrots hate/dog loves
customer_reviews.text: Too big for my conure and Congo African Grey, and they don't like them. But my dog loves them. I would not buy them again, however.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little time for the birds to try them.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard348

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price for Zupreem, and of course my Cockatoo loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Croffett

customer_reviews.title: NutBlend Parrot Food
customer_reviews.text: Since my Mexican Double Yellow Head parrot loves nuts, I figure he would love this product. Unfortunately, he didn't like it. The only one he liked was the Brazilian shaped nut, and the rest were either thrown on the floor or tossed into his water bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Taste varies from bird to bird.
customer_reviews.text: This just did not suit my bird's taste. It was tried by itself and mixed in with other food. If mixed in, she picked it out and dropped it to the bottom of her cage. Just not her thing.
customer_reviews.author: TW Brown, Author, Editor, and Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your
customer_reviews.text: My macaw would not eat it. Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: tawnya reber

customer_reviews.title: Zupreem Nut Blend
customer_reviews.text: My Yellow Naped Amazon parrot loves this. I use it in a three part mix of Zupreem pellets. It's large enough for him to hold in his claws. He only likes things he can hold to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Diana H.

customer_reviews.title: He liked it
customer_reviews.text: My blue front liked it and gobbled it up...until the novelty wore off. Then he'd just pick at it or toss it out of the bowl. So while it's obviously good, it's not something I can feed him more then once or twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: My blue and gold parrot, doesn't care for this ...
customer_reviews.text: My blue and gold parrot, doesn't care for this. He is always shoveling it out of his bowl all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Walter

customer_reviews.title: ohh nhuio hn h bu bu ihij iojjpkjk klihu ygghghhj ...
customer_reviews.text: ohh nhuio hn h bu bu ihij iojjpkjk klihu ygghghhj ijijiii
customer_reviews.author: Larry Larkin

customer_reviews.title: My bird loves it
customer_reviews.text: My macawis rather picky and she took right to this food. The pellets are nut shaped.. Had used the ZuPreen fruit in the past and she would pick out certain colors and not eat them. Highly recommend. She especially loves it when I mix it with Jungle Munchies.
customer_reviews.author: OB2OBX

customer_reviews.title: My bird loves it like no other food
customer_reviews.text: My bird loves it like no other food. Very light in weight, so it takes a fair volume to provide enough
customer_reviews.author: John Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Good food
customer_reviews.text: Good to be able to get the quality food for my parrot.
customer_reviews.author: cindy kalior

customer_reviews.title: another one of his favorite foods.
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey is a picky eater but he absolutely loves this!! I think he also enjoys having a change from this brand's fruit blend, another one of his favorite foods.
customer_reviews.author: AGJ

customer_reviews.title: My birds like it but it is too large for medium and small birds
customer_reviews.text: My birds like this flavor but it only comes in one size so I have to break it up for my medium and small size birds.l I wish it came smaller.l
customer_reviews.author: JOYCE FLEMING

customer_reviews.title: My african grey doesn't seem to really like these. He will eat them but only when ...
customer_reviews.text: My african grey doesn't seem to really like these. He will eat them but only when it's left in the bowl. He will take all of the Veggie and the Fruit ones first.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: Pelleted food is a good choice
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey likes everything but the small round pellets in this food. Feed this product daily. Much healthier choice than fattening seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and nutrition in a tasty pellet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and nutrition as I would expect from Zupreem. My cockatoo loves the shapes and taste of this food.
customer_reviews.author: Maine Cockatoo Lady

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Zupreem blends for birds are all good, my macaw likes this flavor. She is older and somewhat picky. I feed her different flavors to add variety to her diet.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mc.

customer_reviews.title: My super picky Blue and Gold will eat these!
customer_reviews.text: This is Zekes other favorite next to th fruity pellets. How can anyone it want these pellets they smell so good makes me wonder if thus be good in milk!
customer_reviews.author: Bird Lady 147

customer_reviews.title: At least it isn't seeds but...
customer_reviews.text: My birds love Zupreem nut blend and I figured out why, sugar. I tasted the pellets and they are sweet, tastes like cookies and sugar is one of the top ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Mouchette

customer_reviews.title: My African Grey loves these! He had been starting ...
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey loves these! He had been starting to get picky with the fruit blend, so wanted to give him some variety.
customer_reviews.author: Madi

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: My Macaw would not eat this blend. I will stick with the natural and fruit blend.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Burditt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: zupreem is about the only pellets I will feed my parrots
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for (2) 3.25lb bags.
customer_reviews.text: It’s odd that I had to review the flavor of a parrot pellet... but it’s my bird’s favorite so I’ll give it 5 stars?
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bertolino

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Birds like and eat them. Nice to be able to provide variety in their staple diet.
customer_reviews.author: fastmed13

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good basic bird food, but needs other pellets with it.
customer_reviews.author: Reid Fishman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My umbrella cockatoo loves these pellets! Just wish supreme sold them in a variety of sizes
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: My two Birds hate it
customer_reviews.text: I have an African Grey and a Senegal Both think it taste bad. They pick it up then spit it out. My Senegal is not picky either. Now I have some food for the squirrels. Will not purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Todd

customer_reviews.title: Macaw loves this
customer_reviews.text: My macaw loves this blend. Its the first time she has spent more time eating instead of throwing the food. Definitely recommend for your picky eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: And they smell pretty good if you like the smell of peanut butter
customer_reviews.text: My grey loves these! And they smell pretty good if you like the smell of peanut butter. It is one of the few pellets I can get her to eat.
customer_reviews.author: M

product_meta.title: ZuPreem NutBlend Smart Pellets Bird Food for Parrots and Conures| Made in USA, Daily Nutrition, Essential Vitamins, Minerals for African Greys, Senegals, Amazons, Eclectus, Cockatoos
product_meta.description: Size:3.25 lb bagZuPreem Avian Maintenance Nut Blend Premium Bird Diet for Medium & Large Birds You know birds go nuts for nuts, which is why your bird will love our ZuPreem Avian Maintenance Premium Bird Diet. You'll love it too because it is a nutritious diet your bird needs every day for good health. This premium daily bird food is trusted and recommended by veterinarians and fed by top breeders. Flavor Bird Food is created by the bird loving people at ZuPreem.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA specifically for Conures, Caiques, African Greys, Senegals, Amazons, Eclectus and Small Cockatoos.
HEALTHY and DELICIOUS NutBlend Smart Pellets with natural nut flavor. Made with real whole grains from North America’s Heartland.
ESSENTIAL NUTRITION. Includes Vitamins and Minerals to provide the foundation of your bird’s diet.
FEED DAILY to provide your bird essential nutrition for a healthy and balanced diet.

CONVERT YOUR BIRD TO A HEALTHIER DIET. Converting your bird to a food that includes pellets is worth the effort for his/her health and wellbeing. ZuPreem has been dedicated to producing innovative, high-quality products since 1967.
